    • Method Detail

      • getCollapseKey

        String getCollapseKey()
        An arbitrary string that is used to collapse a group of like messages when the device is offline, so that only the last message gets sent to the client. This is intended to avoid sending too many messages to the phone when it comes back online. Note that since there is no guarantee of the order in which messages get sent, the "last" message may not actually be the last message sent by the application server. Optional, unless you are using the time_to_live parameterâ€”in that case, you must also specify a collapse_key.
        Returns:
        the collapseKey

      • isDelayWhileIdle

        Boolean isDelayWhileIdle()
        Returns:
        If true, indicates that the message should not be sent immediately if the device is idle. The server will wait for the device to become active, and then only the last message for each collapseKey value will be sent. Optional. The default value is false.

      • getTimeToLive

        Integer getTimeToLive()
        Returns:
        How long (in seconds) the message should be kept on GCM storage if the device is offline. Optional (default time-to-live is 4 weeks, the maximum possible value). If you use this parameter, you must also specify a collapse_key.
